Column Comment.0: CONSORTIUM BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the unique identifier for the consortium.
Column Comment.1: SERVICE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the unique identifier for the business associatewho provided the service to the consortium.
Column Comment.2: SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: Unique identifier for the occurance of serviceprovided to the consortium by the service company.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identier for the businessassociate who is a contact for this work.
Column Comment.5: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: textual description of the service provided.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: END DATE: the date that this service was completed.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: PROVISION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the provision in a contract.
Column Comment.12: FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a business associate suchas a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Fee schedules are often usedto administer the rates for rentals or for services provided. .
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: REPRESENTED BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: The unique identifier for the BA onwhose bahalf the service was provided.
Column Comment.15: SERVICE QUALITY: the quality of service that was provided for this work.
Column Comment.16: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE TYPE: A valid list of services for a businessassociate. For example well logger, drilling contractor, application developer. Forland, may be may be address for service, brokerage, maintainor etc.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: START DATE: the date that this service was started.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
